channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: Streetlight is out on Parnall Close, 17th October

item.title: Entrance unsafe, 16th October
item.description:
The entrance to the playing fields has now become unsafe and will only continue to worsen this winter. Hard standing should be extended as this is a low point within the field and the added footfall exacerbates the issue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lynton Road, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree roots thru tarmac raised footpath danger to pedestrians, 16th October
item.description:
Outside 72 Milton Rd Cheltenham GL517ES Tree roots thru tarmac large mound in footpath danger to pedestrians Reported in Aug 2023 Ref 11431722 still not fixed getting a lot worse
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 58, Milton Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Tree branches falling off on highway, 16th October

item.title: The traffic light on the opposite road of Greyhound gardens doesnt turn to red and allow the cars on nine elms road turn right toward to A40, 16th October
item.description:
The traffic light on the opposite road of Greyhound gardens doesnt turn to red and allow the cars on nine elms road turn right toward to A40. and it is causing a long queue in nine elms.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nine Elms Road, Elmbridge, Gloucester

item.category: Traffic light head is facing wrong direction

item.title: Noisy manual cover to drain being repaired before, but is now back to being noisy again, 16th October
item.description:
Bishops Cleeve bypass at the back of my house 18 blackberry grove gl528wl This man cover drain was fixed only a few weeks ago, which seem to have done the job for about three weeks but since we had that awful weather, somethings happened to the drain again and it is constantly making a loud clanking noise like a train track every time a vehicle goes over. As you can appreciate this is a very busy road 24 hours a day, and the sound of this really affects our mental health and well-being as it’s constantly making a noise. Every time of vehicle goes over and interrupting sleep and can’t even sit in the garden due to the noise.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooding due to water coming out of pavement and road, 16th October
item.description:
The road of oldbury where it meets Hesters way road close to number 94. Causing flooding due to burst water main or something else

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 94, Oldbury Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The sign is illegible problem, 16th October
item.description:
Customer states that yesterday a pole was installed in the f/way o/s their property (believed to be a replacement bus stop that was knocked down a few years ago). They have concerns about where it has been placed: states that the pole is right up against their boundary fence and that it will quickly become overgrown by hanging plants that grow on the fence. Asking that it be relocated to its correct position on the kerb side.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 16th October
item.description:
Customer has called to report that a tree at the location is now noticeably listing at around 30 degrees - it has moved in the last week; the roots have started to lift the tarmac on the pavement. They are concerned that it will fall on the adjacent property/pavement.
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 30, Ruby Avenue, Tewkesbury

item.title: General road marking and stud issues problem, 16th October
item.description:
Customer currently has a H Marking that he paid for a few years ago. Customer is asking if this will be redone after the resurfacing. Customer is concerned as the live directly across the road from Charlton Kings Junior School, and parents happily park right across the customers drive blocking their vehicles in.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: Breaking up of upper tarmac, 16th October
item.description:
Deep cracks in the tarmac are causing the road to become loose which over winter will become a hazard, risk to vehicle damage and noise for houses. This is a main bus route and will quickly get worse.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13,15, Linworth Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
